page.title: 11A BURNT MOUND IN EDAY
page.content: Eday has many sites of archaeological interest, including some Burnt Mounds, one of which is situated on the extreme west of the island, just south of Fersness Point. It is of roughly horse shoe shape and measures 10.67m in diameter and 1.37m at its greatest height. At the north side of the mound there are several protruding slabs set on edge, all aligned north and south. These probably represent the house associated with the mound. A drainage ditch has been dug on the north side of this mound and unfortunately this has made it rather difficult to see, with earth piled on top of it.
